result.execSummary:
The defendant Rolando D Drayton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).
  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge; BY 12-31-2016 Any remaining balance will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.  Fine set at ZERO.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence; release for work, AODA treatment, Mental Health Treatment, and school; with credit for 4 days (3-23-2015 to 03-26-2015) time served.
Provide DNA sample, if not already done.
*3/2/2016  additional privileges granted, for the  Day Reporting Center if he qualifies/is eligible for that program.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence; release for work, AODA treatment, Mental Health Treatment, and school;  with credit for 0 days time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.
Curfew for the first year of probation: Defendant is to be home from 9:00pm to 6:00am. Only exception is for verified work or school hours.

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. Fine is set at ZERO.

Regularly participate in an HSED or GED program until completed. 
Maintain fulltime employment/school or a combination of both.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
Defendant may not live where a firearm is kept. 
Defendant may not be in any automobile where a firearm is present.
Mental Health Evaluation and any recommended treatment.

No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
Defendant to not associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate. 
No contact with Marcus W. (DOB 10-27-1972).
No contact with William W. ( DOB 3-12-1995). 
No contact with Steven S. Under section 973.049 Court finds and prohibits contact with Steven S. as he was a witness in the crime in COUNT 1 and 2, and it is in the interest of the public to prohibit contact.
Geographic are restriction within area bordered on West Roosevelt Drive, Milwaukee, WI; West Fond Du Lac, Milwaukee, WI; West Townsend Street, Milwaukee, WI.

Provide a DNA sample, if not already done.
Defendant to participate in a Cognitive Behavior program or cognitive intervention program.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.
Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing at least 1 time per month for the first 12 month of probation.

timeConds.notes: without goodtime credit; Court will rule release privileges during probation review hearing, if stay is lifted. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. Condition time is stayed pending a probation review hearing on 09-23-2016 at 1:30 pm, branch 17.

The defendant's request for release on electronic monitoring is denied as it would unduly depreciate the seriousness of the offense, render the House Of Correction time meaningless and frustrate the court's specific sentencing intent.
The defendant's request for additional privileges is granted AS TO COUNT 1 ONLY, for the Day Reporting Center if he qualifies/is eligible for that program.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rolando D Drayton in court with attorney Jeffrey John Szczewski.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
  Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1 -
Court ordered defendant to serve 8 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence; release for work, AODA treatment, Mental Health Treatment, and school; with credit for 4 days (3-23-2015 to 03-26-2015) time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge; BY 12-31-2016 Any remaining balance will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 

AS TO COUNT 2 -
Court ordered defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence; release for work, AODA treatment, Mental Health Treatment, and school;  with credit for 0 days time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 

COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE in Count 2 and placed defendant on probation for 2 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
- Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing at least 1 time per month for the first 12 month of probation.
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Defendant may not live where a firearm is kept. 
- Defendant may not be in any automobile where a firearm is present. 
- Regularly participate in an HSED or GED program until completed. 
- Maintain fulltime employment/school or a combination of both. 
- Defendant to not associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate. 
- No contact with Marcus W. (DOB 10-27-1972).
- No contact with William W. ( DOB 3-12-1995). 
- No contact with Steven S. Under section 973.049 Court finds and prohibits contact with Steven S. as he was a witness in the crime in COUNT 1 and 2, and it is in the interest of the public to prohibit contact.
- Geographic are restriction within area bordered on West Roosevelt Drive, Milwaukee, WI; West Fond Du Lac, Milwaukee, WI; West Townsend Street, Milwaukee, WI.
- Mental Health Evaluation and any recommended treatment. 
- Defendant to participate in a Cognitive Behavior program or cognitive intervention program.
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Curfew for the first year of probation: Defendant is to be home from 9:00pm to 6:00am. Only exception is for verified work or school hours. 
- Court ordered defendant to serve 6 MONTHS CONDITION TIME  in the House of Correction without goodtime credit; Court will rule release privileges  during probation review hearing, if stay is lifted. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. Condition time is stayed pending a probation review hearing on 09-23-2016 at 1:30 pm, branch 17. 
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

The Court informed the defendant of requirements and penalties applicable under s. 941.29(1m) or (4m).

For the reasons placed on the record, the Court DENIED the Defense request for expungement.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant.
Two letters on behalf of defendant, received and filed. tk

Exhibit List, Jury Trial received and filed.

Verdict Count 1  " We, the jury, find the defendant, Rolando Drayton, guilty of carrying a concealed weapon, as charged in the Count 1 of the information."
Verdict Count 2 " We, the jury, find the defendant, Rolando Drayton, guilty of possession of a controlled substance, tetrahydrocannabinols (THC) as charged in the Count 2 of the information."

Court addressed bail conditons to include:
- No Contact with William W. DOB 3-12-1995
- No Contact with Marcus W. DOB 10-1992
- No Contact with Steven S. or his residence.
- If defendant changes residence to notify Cour within 1 business day.
All other conditions of bail to remain.

Defendant Rolando D Drayton in court with attorney Jeffrey John Szczewski.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Jury in the box at 9:27 am. Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 9:35 to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Ewerd and Berlin who were duly sworn for that purpose.  At the hour of 11:19 the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdicts of GUILTY as to COUNT 1 and COUNT 2 which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction. State request defendant remanded. Court denies states request. Court added additional conditions of bail.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, any victims, and the defendant. Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 3 business days in advance of the sentencing. 

Case adjourned for sentencing hearing on 01-04-2016 at 8:30 am, branch 17.

Defendant Rolando D Drayton in court with attorney Jeffrey John Szczewski.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Jury in the box at 1:30pm. Trial continued.  Sworn for the state: Ofc. Raynaldo Roman, MPD, Ofc. Daniel Smokolbiach, MPD, Ofc. Steven Voss, MPD, Jepp Zwickey, controlled substances analyst, Wisconsin State Crime Lab . Exhibits 11-12 received.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of box at 2:36pm.  Defense motion for directed verdict as to count 1 at close of state's case denied by the court.   Court finds upon questioning, the defendant knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waived right to testify. Jury in the box at 4:03pm. State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense. Jury excused for the day at 4:50pm. Judge to retain this file.


  Jury trial scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
